medical_history.chief_complaint: Acute lower mid-abdominal pain for six days
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient developed acute lower abdominal pain six days ago that woke him from sleep, accompanied by night sweats. The pain, described as a stabbing pain that comes and goes in waves, radiates from the suprapubic region to the umbilicus. It improved initially but has recurred and become more constant over the last few days. He had a day of constipation but has had regular bowel movements otherwise. The pain improves with ibuprofen and movement and worsens after eating.
medical_history.family_history: Grandfather had cancer; sister may have inflammatory bowel disease (IBD)
